To zoom in, use [Ctrl]   [ ] in Windows, and [Cmd]   [ ] on a Mac. To zoom out, use the keyboard shortcut [Ctrl]   [-] in Windows and [Cmd]   [-] on a Mac.
You don’t have to be a Yale student to have access to a Yale education.
From online courses to on-campus experiences, there are a range of learning opportunities available for non-degree seekers.
Audit a class or take courses for credit without matriculating as a Yale undergraduate.​
The Office of International Affairs offers a suite of global leadership programs on important topics and trends for professionals, experts, and life-long learners from around the world.

Our certificate programs feature multiple courses organized in an integrated curriculum. Access the expertise of Yale faculty and deepen your networks by joining small cohorts of working professionals.
Free and for-credit Yale courses covering topics from game theory to modern poetry are available to undergraduates, graduate students, and the general public.

This leadership development program brings 16 innovative thinkers and doers to campus for four months of learning, collaboration, and research; they go on to become part of a global network of World Fellows.
The Yale for Life program for alumni invites participants to New Haven for a one-week, immersive learning experience. All courses are led by Yale professors and focus on a particular subject.
In this academic summer program, exceptional high school students from the United States and abroad who are interested in politics and international affairs live and learn on campus.
